<pageclass class="#AA7592" subcaption="MTA-MySQL Module"></pageclass>

{{ModuleFunction|MTA-MySQL}}
Returns the name of a given field in the last executed query. The offset of the field must be an integer between '''1''' and '''[[/Modules/MTA-MySQL/mysql_num_rows/mysql_num_fields.md|mysql_num_fields()]]'''

==Syntax==
<syntaxhighlight lang="lua">
int mysql_field_name ( MySQLResult result, int offset )
</syntaxhighlight>
===Required arguments===
* '''result:''' A valid MySQL result
* '''offset:''' A valid offset

===Returns===
The given field name.

===Example===
'''Example 1:'''
<syntaxhighlight lang="lua">
local result = mysql_query(handler, "SELECT name FROM account WHERE id='1' LIMIT 1") -- Execute the query
if (result) then
  local str = mysql_field_name(result, 1)
  outputDebugString(str) -- Will print 'name'
  mysql_free_result(result) -- Free the result
end
</syntaxhighlight>
